title: Covid-19: How Digital Health Passports Could Help Us Travel Again
author: Lainey Loh
description: Digital health passports or vaccine visas are being trialled to enable travellers to fly again and nudge tourism towards post-Covid-19 pandemic recovery.
cleaned_text: As Covid-19 vaccination programmes begin rolling out in many parts of the world, some Asia-Pacific countries are now running a trial on digital health passports To support the safe reopening of borders and travel bubbles, and to enable us to travel again, [digital tools](https://my.asiatatler.com/life/covid-19-technology-trends) are being employed to certify passengers' immunity from Covid-19. In fact, approximately [20 airlines](https://www.flightglobal.com/airlines/iata-health-passport-app-to-roll-out-with-20-airlines/142369.article) worldwide will begin testing an app from the International Air Transport Association (IATA) which will allow passengers to securely store and present the health records they need to travel internationally. Read more: [Travel Bubble & How 11 Asia-Pacific Countries Are Restarting Travel](https://my.asiatatler.com/life/travel-bubble-11-asia-pacific-countries-that-are-forming-their-own) On December 23, 2020, Singapore Airlines started trials on a new digital health passport on passengers travelling on its flights from Jakarta and Kuala Lumpur to Singapore. Passengers who have taken their Covid-19 tests at selected clinics in Jakarta and Kuala Lumpur can use the digital health passport, known as [Travel Pass](https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2021/02/23/aviation-aims-for-the-sky-with-iata-travel-pass), to verify their Covid-19 test results and ensure they meet Singapore's [entry requirements](https://my.asiatatler.com/life/travel-safe-guide-to-travelling-during-the-covid-19-pandemic). Aside from offering a faster and more secure way to validate a passenger's health credentials, the Travel Pass will help speed up check-in and immigration processes, resulting in a more seamless experience. If successful, [Singapore Airlines](https://my.asiatatler.com/life/singapore-airlines-restaurant-a380-at-changi-review) could extend it to other cities in its route network. Similarly, Air New Zealand has also announced it will trial a digital travel pass to give airlines and border authorities access to passenger health information, including their [Covid-19 vaccination](https://my.asiatatler.com/life/vaccines-in-malaysias-covid-vaccination-programme-pfizer-astrazeneca-sinovac-cansinobio-sputnik-v) status. Dubbed a 'vaccination passport' by industry observers, the pass is intended to streamline travel once borders reopen by allowing passengers to store their health credentials in one place. See also: [Covid-19 Vaccine: Malaysians Abroad On Receiving Their Vaccinations](https://my.asiatatler.com/society/covid-19-vaccine-vaccination-malaysians-abroad) The airline is scheduled to roll out the trial in April on flights between Auckland and Sydney.
